answers.answer: The "eye doctor" you're seeing should be an Eye MD ophthalmologist physician to accept that explanation. IF you're seeing a non-MD, non-physician optometrist you have not been evaluated properly.Double vision just in left gaze could be a left lateral rectus palsy (6th cranial nerve) and that can be due to some very serious problems like small strokes, tumors, aneurysms, diabetes, etc.If the double vision is new you need a full work up which would included seeing an ophthalmologist ideally a neuroophthalmologist or strabismus specialist and possibly a neurologist. Blood work and MRI likely necessary also.JCH MD

question: I experience double vision only while looking to my left.  After many tests by the eye doctor nothing was found to be wrong with my eyes.  I have uncorrected 20/15 vision.  I have also gotten my blood drawn for tests and she suggested I also get 2 MRI's.  I have no other symptoms involved ie-numbness,nausea,tingling, headaches etc.  She believes its a virus affecting one of the "things" that control the eye movement.  She states if that is the case of it being a virus it "should" work it self out in 2 wks to 6 mths.  Is there any truth to this and should I go further by seeing some sort of specialist?
title: double vision
